medicines.name: Paracetamol
cautions: Not suitable for children under 2 years

dosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

medicines.additional_notes: May interact with certain medications. Consult a healthcare provider for specific advice.

medicines.name: Ibuprofen
cautions: Increases risk of stomach ulcers with prolonged use
Not recommended for individuals with kidney issues

dosage.children: 10 mg per kg of body weight every 6-8 hours

medicines.additional_notes: Take with food to reduce stomach irritation.

medicines.name: Amoxicillin
cautions: Allergic reactions in individuals sensitive to penicillin

dosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

interactions: May reduce the effectiveness of oral contraceptives
medicines.additional_notes: Complete the full course even if symptoms improve to prevent resistance.

medicines.name: Aspirin
cautions: Not recommended for children under 16 (risk of Reye's syndrome)
Can cause stomach ulcers with prolonged use
medicines.safe_during_pregnancy: No, especially in the third trimester
medicines.additional_notes: Aspirin is commonly used for its blood-thinning properties but should be used cautiously in specific populations.

medicines.name: Loratadine
cautions: May cause drowsiness in sensitive individuals
Use with caution if you have liver or kidney disease

dosage.children: 5 mg once daily for children aged 2-5

interactions: May interact with certain antibiotics like erythromycin
medicines.additional_notes: This is a non-drowsy antihistamine commonly used for seasonal allergies.

medicines.name: Ciprofloxacin
cautions: Avoid in children under 18 (risk of joint and tendon issues)
May cause tendon rupture in adults
Avoid sun exposure as it increases sensitivity to sunlight
interactions: Avoid with antacids or dairy products
medicines.additional_notes: Ciprofloxacin is a powerful antibiotic and should be used carefully due to its potential side effects on tendons.

medicines.name: Cetirizine
cautions: Use with caution in patients with kidney disease

dosage.children: 5 mg once daily for children aged 2-6

interactions: May interact with alcohol or sedatives
Use caution when driving or operating machinery
medicines.additional_notes: Cetirizine is a common non-drowsy antihistamine for allergies, though some individuals may experience mild drowsiness.
